website_summaries.verdict: A very popular multi-function model that offers a variety of features for a reasonable price.
pros: Has the ability to print borderless, right out to the edges of standard printer paper
cons: Some owners note a delay before the machine actually starts printing

website_summaries.verdict: The HP Envy 4520 is a capable all-in-one that combines a printer, copier and scanner with two ink delivery choices designed to ease back on expensive ink refills.
pros: The HP Envy 4520 printer uses the latest ink delivery technologies to prolong cartridge life and potentially save you money through its Instant Ink delivery service
It also scored well in print speed tests and produced high-quality output results
cons: The printer lacks a memory card reader and an Ethernet port for direct networking
The touch display can also be tricky to use

customer_reviews.title: "This is a pretty simple solution that not many people know
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the problems with this printer that others have complained about. I followed advice from this poster: "This is a pretty simple solution that not many people know, but here's how to disable the annoying instant ink pop-ups: You can disable the notifications through Printer Server Properties. (Click on your Control Panel, then the Devices and Printers tab) >From Devices and Printers. Highlight your printer, then look above for a tab called "Print server properties" across the top. Click the tab, then click the Advanced tab and uncheck both "Show informational notifications for local printers and network printers" boxes. Apply and click OK. Hope this helps!"
customer_reviews.author: Bess378

customer_reviews.title: ... concerned with buying this product based on people having bad experiences with the HP auto order ink thing
customer_reviews.text: Was a little concerned with buying this product based on people having bad experiences with the HP auto order ink thing. Turns out you absolutely do not have to deal with that. I just plugged the printer in, connected it to my wifi, and then selected it to be my printer from Windows 10 and it's worked with no problem, never once hassling me about ordering ink. My guess is the issue other people are experiencing comes from installing the HP software which doesn't appear to be necessary. I can also print from my phone with no problem. I'd recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: IA_Hawk

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!  I was scammed on HP installation web site  "123.hp.com/setup
customer_reviews.text: I got SCAMMED! This review is not regarding the quality of the product but a STRONG BUYER BEWARE. DO NOT TRUST HP on the installation! As directed I went to "123.hp.com/setup to install this new printer to my computer. I did not want to purchase the ink plan. During the automatic installation process a warning came up regarding security of my computer and that I would have problems using the printer. I searhed for the phone number for HP installation help, called and they took over my computer and tried to charge money for security for my computer. I was all a scam caused​ by the installation process listed in theHP booking for using their product.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Van Allen

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware. This printer is "HPInstantInk" eligible. This translates to a pop-up in the printer control screen EVERY TIME YOU PRINT until you sign up for their Automatic Cartridge Replacement Service. HP WILL NOT assist in disabling this pop-up. Every time you replace a printer cartridge, this intimidation resets.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend against buying this printer. After setup, it worked properly for about two months, but over the last couple months it has been a nightmare. Essentially, it keeps dropping off the network (in theory, at least, I have it set up for wireless connectivity) and I have to try to re-establish wireless connections. I say try, because the HP site takes me in a Moebius circle. The help page in particular is of absolutely no value, and when I have been able to get the printer back online, it has been completely through trial and error. This printer is not the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: lec

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want to print from your Android
customer_reviews.text: Super frustrated. When I first got this printer and installed it, everything worked perfectly. I don't print that often. I have spent my entire day trying to figure out why I cannot print from my Android. I was able to print from it before, just fine. I have been to HP solution center and on line forums. My settings are correct on the printer and on my phone. Don't buy this if you want to spend hours trying to make it print from your phone. It's brand new, barely used, and not working properly anymore. I guess you get what you pay for. I am ready to pitch it out in the trash. POS
customer_reviews.author: K W

customer_reviews.title: Instant Ink program killed the deal for me. Item returned.
customer_reviews.text: There is one main reason I sent this back to Amazon. It was because of HP's Instant Ink program. Even thought I opted out of it during setup, I got an 'Instant Ink' popup EVERY TIME I printed something. Hey HP, you asked and I declined, end of story. I can buy my own ink cartridges. I don't need a constant reminder of your money making ink program. I barely print 10 pages or pictures a month..
customer_reviews.author: James S. of Texas

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I've ever owned. I've had printers since the 9 pin dot matrix days. This new Envy is the best. It prints #10 business sized envelopes without a sweat. No jams! The scanner is much faster than my 3 year old HP printer. I bought it when it was under $50, and I realized it only cost twice what a print cartridge for my old printer cost. Why buy two ink cartridges when I can get a new printer for the same price? I did not install the software that came with the printer. I just allowed windows to download drivers for it. I have gotten no pop ups at all.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob911

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk never stays online.
customer_reviews.text: This stupid printer never stays online, even fought with HP "tech support" who completely ignored the reason I called and just Sloooowly led me through the install process. HP- make a way to turn off the "auto off" feature. It's stupid! Just a remider if your are thinking of buying an HP4520... DON'T DO IT!! #@^#%#^*6
customer_reviews.author: RoborobSA

customer_reviews.title: Getting problematic so soon!
customer_reviews.text: I never bought any HP items because of their reputation isn't so good, but I thought i gave it a try because of an Amazon deal and did I get what i deserve. I used the printer less than 20 times, and the printing already show problems! On my newest papers, some lines would not print out, for example the whole line of letters would have top part missing due to printer unable to put ink on. It was fine in previous prints, and it is definitely not cause of low ink because I have only used it a few times, and the machine shows no warning of lower ink. Bottom line, don't buy this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm furious. This thing worked the first day and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm furious. This thing worked the first day and printed two pages and by day 2 it wouldn't work at all. First it said I wasn't connected to a network so I set that back up. Then it said something was wrong with my software and it uninstalled it and set that back. It still doesn't work. It shows it's still connected to the network and everything should be working but it doesn't. It literally printed 2 pages of 1 document and then quit working and I'm on deadline. Oh, and the whole time it's not working, I keep getting asked if want to join their ink club. Why would I ever buy anything from HP again? Junk!
customer_reviews.author: joshu r wheetley

customer_reviews.title: Worse printer I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Such a garbage machine. I know I picked it up for sixty bucks, so my expectations were low. But, how horrible this machine is... is shocking. They really shouldn't sell something so nonfunctioning. I barely prints a standard black and white copy, much less all that it claims to accomplish. It is fussy about paper and ink and projects of any size. It is a ink waster and demands that you waste ink when each cartridge is changed. Beyond bad, this one. I hope no one ever buys this load of crud... ever.
customer_reviews.author: tee

customer_reviews.title: Ink gone within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Add my printer to the list of duds. Actually, it's the ink cartridges. I put in brand new, HP 63 cartridges only about 2 weeks ago (after the original ones stopped working). I thought these would last longer, but just now the black one ran dry! And I only print very occasionally and never very many pages. I'm going back to my old Brother Laser printer. It doesn't print color, but it is a workhorse and the toner lasted FOREVER.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great and Cost-Effective
customer_reviews.text: A great and cost-effective wireless printer. Setting it up on my iPhone and the CD installation for my laptop was super easy. Now I can print right from my phone, even if I'm not home. Like other reviews mention, don't enlist in the HP Ink services and don't install needless software other than the normal printing software, otherwise you can be spammed with information. My only complaints are minor: the ink cartridges that come in the box are "starters," meaning they don't have as much as a normal cartridge would, and the automatic paper tray doesn't close after it folds out. Definitely not deal breakers, just things to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Comes with drivers that are like MALWARE, cartridges stop working for no reason
customer_reviews.text: The drivers are like malware, frequently shoving advertisements in your face, spamming your eye balls with rubbish about savings on new cartridges. Incredible that HP think people are STUPID enough to pay to be spammed! Don't install the default malware-drivers, go to their website and install the "Minimum drivers" to avoid all the spam-malware-esque annoyances. This thing will self destruct ink cartridges if not used regular..... So dont think you only have to buy ink once a year; the cartridges simply stop working when half full if not used frequently; gee, im sure thats an accident! Overall this printer makes you feel like you have been hacked and mugged at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bezos

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but issues.
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying this printer. It has been nothing but issues since I got it. I don't print a lot. This is just for home use and infrequent use at that. The machine gives a paper jam error after printing approx. 5 pages. It takes multiple trouble shooting tries to clear the message. This last time I have tried for 2 days. I am giving up. When it does print, it prints well, and the ink is not terribly expensive. But the fact that I can't print without multiple issues leaves me looking for a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: RN mommy

customer_reviews.title: Buy cartridges when you but the printer....
customer_reviews.text: Used the printer once to print test page and the color cartridge quit working. I expected the ones that come with the printer to last a shorter time than the ones you buy but one time use is ridiculous. Have to wait for new cartridges to arrive before I can even finish the set up.
customer_reviews.author: jheinzel

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this HP PRINT SCAM - they are like a mafia protection racket – pay us monthly or ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER It will ONLY Print if you are enrolled in the Instant INK Program. I was enrolled for a year and a half – never printed enough for them to send me a new cartridge. I cancelled my enrollment because not worth it for me – now the printer WON’T PRINT AT ALL! Avoid this HP PRINT SCAM - they are like a mafia protection racket – pay us monthly or else!
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Cross your fingers
customer_reviews.text: Built out of cheap looking plastic, this printer is OK if you can get it to connect to your WiFi system, which is no easy task. And then you have to keep it working, which is even more difficult. To achieve either or both, you will probably end up in the hands of the HP Tech Support people. Good luck. It's hit or miss. Some are fine and some seem unfamiliar with their own products and unable to communicate what little they do know. There are a whole slew of cheap printers out there and you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: poor college student
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I use this to print homework assignments and the occasional document for work. I'm not printing photos or charts or anything fancy. However, as a simple, poor college student, this was budget-friendly, and even more importantly, user-friendly. It was really easy to set up. It's not suuuper efficient with ink, but I got the cheapest-possible HP ink plan along with it, which saves a lot of money compared to buying expensive cartridges every few months. If you're looking for anything cutting-edge, I doubt this is your model, but being able to scan and print wirelessly? So convenient, and so much better than waiting in line to use the printers at school!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It prints when it wants to be available
customer_reviews.text: Really had high hopes for this printer but after 3 years, I'm finally tossing it in the trash. Biggest issue is that it regularly shows as disconnected even with the power on. I shouldn't have to play around with settings every time I want to print just so the printer can then appear online. So frustrating! The print quality was never great but it was certainly passable for daily needs. I'd never print pictures from it though. The settings were OK to use, nothing great but they got the job done. All in all, I really hated this printer since the day I bought it and I'm finally fed up. No more HP printers in my house again.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Printer locks up
customer_reviews.text: This printer is terrible. I bought this for my mother in law because I have the envy 4500 and it has been a great printer. This 4520 locks up and will not print. It still indicates that it’s connected to the network, but it just won’t do anything until a power cycle (fully off, unplugged, then back on). I have tried setting it to a static IP and it still has the issue. Even when it’s directly plugged in over USB. The window to return it has passed and now I’m stuck with this terrible paper weight unless HP releases a new firmware that resolves this issue.
customer_reviews.author: jesse parker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, just terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the worst printers I have ever dealt with. It was purchased for a family member that is not computer savvy for the sole purpose of ease of use. It has turned into a nightmare of epic proportions. It will not pair with MS surface computer, no mater how many times it was installed, re-installed, deleted and re-installed again. It prints blank page after blank page on a Dell all in one Windows 10. I'd say this printer is a good paper weight but its not even that. I can not recommend enough to stay away from this product and only wish we could return ours.
customer_reviews.author: rdpoint

customer_reviews.title: A real printer
customer_reviews.text: I got stupid a while back and bought a non-HP printer. It ran out of ink after fewer than two dozen printed pages and refused to print even bad quality pages until I gave it new ink. Those ink cartridges which came with the thing must have been nearly dry to start out. I started to buy more ink when I realized that for only $14 more I could buy an HP and have a real printer again. And that is not to mention that this HP is far superior in quality of construction and features to the nameless one I cast out. I will never stray from the HP printer fold again.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Set up is easy as described by other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Set up is easy as described by other reviewers. Only problem is that Macs no longer have CD/DVD drives so I had to insert the install disc in an old computer I keep and then email myself the files on the disc so I could get the on-screen install instructions. Scanning and printing functions working fine so far. This is not my default printer; don't expect to give it more than really light printing use (have used more for scanning), so the free 'instant ink' program will probably work OK for me. For the $50 I paid for the 4520 I feel I've got more than my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: prpro

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment as color printer
customer_reviews.text: It would be hard to express just what a disappointment this printer is, especially after nearly 10 years of problem free service by my former Kodak printer. I have never been able to print good color photos, with endless streaking and lines that no amount of cleaning, new cartridges or otherwise have been able to fix. It uses ink like crazy for its diagnostics (which I've had to run so much of to fix various problems) and the Windows 10 is no friend of this printer. I will be getting an Epson ecotank and would advise others to bypass this printer. Oh where or where has my kodak gone???
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the Memories HP Envy 4520 Wireless
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer - - and the instant ink is a godsend for forgetful people like me. Unfortunately, I've worn my poor printer out. I have a small sewing business so I tend to print a lot of diagrams (in color), etc. as well as pictures of my grandchildren. I like having ink available when I need it most, AND it's a helluva lot cheaper than buying the same cartridges at Office Max or other stores similar. Needless to say, I'm ordering THE. SAME.PRINTER right NOW.
customer_reviews.author: Janice White

customer_reviews.title: Great product.. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this printer for years now .. I use it for basic home printing and my daughter uses it for homework.. I love that it’s wireless and I can print from any device anywhere in my home .. I had an issue at one point so I reinstalled the software and problem solved .. The ink is pricey but seems to last for a long time! I have recommended it to friends and neighbors and would buy an HP printer again in the future ..
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: 10 year old HP finally gave up so I replaced it with this one. I followed the installation instructions and it was fairly easy given my technologically challenged nature. It connected wirelessly to the laptop with a few glitches but I had to use the USB cord (purchased separately) to connect to the desk top. It just will not work wirelessly with that one - so far - but we'll keep trying. Copies are beautiful and I love that it is so much faster. It came with black/wht and color ink cartridges. I hope it lasts 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: ElenaD3LV

customer_reviews.title: After 14 Months, This Device Earns a One -star Rating
customer_reviews.text: The printer was not easy to set up, and although I had a new HP Desktop, the two didn't seem to recognize each other. I had to install the drivers repeatedly to get it to open the wi-fi connection or accept print jobs from the PC. I joined HP Instant Ink, but now there's an issue with the tricolor cartridge, but there's no way to troubleshoot the issue. The simplest solution would be for HP Instant Ink to send me a replacement cartridge, but they're adamant that since their site can't read the defective cartridge through the network, they won't send me another one. They remain happy, however, to continue billing me each month for the HP Instant Ink plan.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hammond

customer_reviews.title: So far this printer has been amazing, prints fast and wireless from my computer
customer_reviews.text: So far this printer has been amazing, prints fast and wireless from my computer, or tablet. So far the ink usage has been ok wish it could last a bit longer. The printer is fast and pretty much silent without hassles, once you install the software in your device is pretty easy to do what you want, print, scan or copy. The only downside of this printer is the lack of a usb port dock. Other than that a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Clarissagc

customer_reviews.title: Great, but keep a few things in mind...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is overall great, but there are a few things to keep in mind. First of all, there are not individual cartridges for color. There is just a color cartridge and black cartridge. Also there is no USB port for printing straight from USB. The great part about the printer is its network features. It can scan and print over the network and works great with Mac OSX and iOS with Airprint. I have not tested it with my windows devices as of yet. An important thing to remember is to uncheck the Instant Ink box if you don't want that. I unchecked it and I have no issues with pop-ups as others have talked about.
customer_reviews.author: 17yukidesu17

customer_reviews.title: I hate it and it hates me (I hope)
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the worst purchase I've ever made. It prints when it feels like it, sometimes only partial documents. I've tried troubleshooting that issue because I guess I'm not the only person it's happened to, nothing works. I noticed it especially doesn't like to print PDF documents, it either doesn't print them at all or only partially prints them. Also, trying to figure out how to contact customer service is fun game. Eff HP, I HATE this printer. Quick addition 2 years later, it also jams all the time, it's about to go in the dumpster. Worst purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: I'm super annoyed with what a ripoff this printer is
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these...one for my classroom and one for home. Black ink is about $20 and color ink is about $30. I have gone through cartridge after cartridge before realizing how quickly I was running out. I SAVED MONEY by just taking my printed items to Office Depot and printing there. I'm super annoyed with what a ripoff this printer is. If I were to hook it up to the auto hp ink if go bankrupt! And I do not print many things. I'm talking 20-30 colored pages and the cartridge is GONE. $1.50 a sheet is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Constant cleaning required- wastes a lot of ink and paper
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this every day- I usually go 1-2 weeks between printing. I only use their recommended ink cartridges, but the black ink ALWAYS has issues. I have to go through multiple cleanings and alignments before I can print a document you can actually read each time. This means I am printing 5-6 documents (minimum) for cleaning and alignment every time I need 1 piece of paper printed. I have tried replacing the black cartridge even though it is more than 3/4 full, but this still happens with every black cartridge. The color cartridge holds up fine. Wasting most of my ink and paper? not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer. Love that I can easily print from ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Love that I can easily print from phone, tablet or any of my other devices, at home or away. The prints come out very nicely and I haven't had any issue with this printer so far. I don't use the auto order for ink. It is not mandatory as some reviewers have said. You simply choose no when you are asked if you want to have your printer auto order ink when it starts to get low. Also I got mine at a very good price here. I've seen other printers that do half as much but cost twice the price of this one. Highly recommended this printer.
customer_reviews.author: maggies mom

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this product
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the first one, it was DOA so we sent it back and ordered another one, we have always liked HP but will not buy another one- ever. When we had the second one literally just out of the box, then turned it on the screen read "error" immediately. We called the CS department which had some off-shore, pre-trained hard to understand, and pushy person with a very thick accent who insisted we had a virus in our computers, demanded our bank account information to pay a "TAX" of almost $200 and allow him access to our laptop to correct the issue. No way Jose, we hung up and ordered a Canon all in one printer. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: MB57

customer_reviews.title: won't connect with computer most of the time; horrible
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned this printer for a year. It has been a miserable year. Over and over and over again I have not been able to get the printer to connect with my computer; I have gone online innumerable times to google "HP Envy 4520 won't connect" or the like; I have had to fix it over and over and over again. What a piece of junk. I would be perfectly happy to just use a cord but that doesn't work either. If you want a horrible experience, buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: kareninca

customer_reviews.title: Wifi printing for the family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace my last one when it broke down. Pros: Everyone in my family can easily print from where they are in the house. This is very handy which means we can also put this printer in any room of the house as well. Scanner/copier works great, very fast. Ink cartridges are affordable and we can choose a subscription ink cartridge service (we opt out however). It works great with all types of mediums. Very easy to use. Cons: It was noisier than I hoped. It sits in my office and I get started every time my husband prints something.
customer_reviews.author: frootbat31

customer_reviews.title: Been quite awhile since I needed a new printer...
customer_reviews.text: And, after looking at what was available these days, I chose this one, given all of the features it included, and, the relatively low cost. Seemed almost too good to be true, and, I went in seriously wondering if this was going to be a gem, or, a nightmare. Nothing ventured, nothing gained. I feel I chose well. The printer has given me nothing but great performance, with none of the issues I've had with previous printers. Given the complexity of the device, HP has made the set up and maintenance of the device pretty simple. Even this old goat can do it. I am quite pleased with this product. I would easily recommend this printer to casual printer users.
customer_reviews.author: Otter with an AK

customer_reviews.title: I have barely used it and in exactly 2 years the printer fails
customer_reviews.text: It's useful to write a review after using the product for a long time. I have used the printer gently, kept the heads cleaned, have replenished the ink. It is is a programming program it seems because there is ink, the heads are clean enough to print some lines well. other lines are smudged black. Electronics, particularly of this size, should/are expected to last for many years. The waste is considerable, to my pocketbook and to the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Isa

customer_reviews.title: Well-named HP Envy 2450 printer
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this $65 printer for features and ease of use. The setup was a breeze once I got it connected to my home WiFi. It even allows me to print from my Galaxy S7 phone without any additional setup just by enabling the print function on my phone. HP offers an automatic ink re-ordering service but I bought an extra HP 63 Black & Tri-Color set of ink cartridges because it wasn't clear that the printer would come with ink cartridges (it did) so I haven't tried out this service yet. Everyone in my family has been using this printer for the past month (both Windows and Mac OS systems) with no problems...
customer_reviews.author: QuestionEverything

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the quality of this printer, it started jammimg paper after one month of light use and now after just two months the copies are coming out smeary. Just a day past the support deadline and the return window was only one month! Guess we are stuck with it. Surprised that an HP product is such poor quality, we have had HP printers in the past with no problems...
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann

customer_reviews.title: Beware of HP shady business practices!! Read This!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother as a gift. She signed up for the HP ink delivery program. They charged her twice, never sent her any ink, and then remotely locked her printer from printing anything because they said she owed them $0.99. I think the printer worked ok for the incredibly few pages she printed before HP locked it. My mother is not at all technology friendly, so when it stopped working, she just stopped printing things. Incredibly unacceptable customer support. That HP would even put in the ability to remotely lock your hardware that you purchased should be criminal.
customer_reviews.author: BamaMania

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for Light Use
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more and gotten a better printer or gone to a different brand. It is fine for printing out single sheets with low volume, but I am still struggling to figure out how to do double-sided copies since it does not do it automatically like my previous printer. My previous printer had a full, large tray. The tray for paper is very small, and only a small spindle comes out when the paper is printing/discharged. I do not use my printer a lot, buy it is disappointing even for light use.
customer_reviews.author: slh

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think this is a great printer. Before I purchased this printer, I had the HP Office jet 4500 wireless printer for 6 years. The setup was very simple. I had no use for the disk since my computer does not have a CD/disk drive. I downloaded the software from the HP website necessary to install the printer. Also connecting to my home internet/Wi-Fi was a very easy process. The HP instant ink reminder was a bit annoying but I was able to disable stop the reminder from showing up when I printed. I also like that I am able to print from my iPhone and iPad.
customer_reviews.author: CurlyEccentric

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up. I love being able to print from my phone and iPad! I also like to make cards and print the occasional picture. I have done one photo on photo paper. The print was very muddy - not sharp at all. I made a card with color graphics. I wasted card stock with muddy, unusable results. I finally got a nice card on the third try. The printer is very slow. I prefer my 8 yr. old HP Photosmart C7200 which had gotten quirky. The introductory black ink cartridge was used up very quickly. I wanted paper until I figured out that my printing problem was low ink.
customer_reviews.author: SheltieGirlV

customer_reviews.title: Uses way too much ink
customer_reviews.text: It prints fine, although slowly. I like the scanning feature (works well, easy to use) and the touchscreen. We haven’t had any paper jam issues, although it doesn’t hold much paper so I’m constantly refilling. What I really DON’T like is the ridiculous amount of ink it uses!!! We bought this six months ago with new ink cartridges, and we’ve already had to buy ink twice. That’s four cartridges we’ve gone through in six months! We homeschool and print often, but that was over summer break - so only a fraction of the printing we normally do. Really wish I would’ve just paid for the parts to fix my old printer instead of buying this throwaway version.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but Problems!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer last January and have had nothing but problems with it. One year later, it doesn't work at all. The biggest problem is that it only accepts NEW HP ink cartridges. If you use a refilled cartridge or off-brand, it tells you that the cartridge is empty or not installed correctly. While the printer is inexpensive, having to use HP ink is expensive! I have no idea what is wrong with it now since it won't accept any ink cartridges! I'm very disappointed in this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly S

customer_reviews.title: Only one issue
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is that when I make a pdf by scanning I can't put in 10 pages and make one pdf. I have to do 1 page at a time and have separate pdf's which I then combine into one. If no not for that inconvenience this would be the perfect printer at the a perfect price.
customer_reviews.author: Biggitty Bam

customer_reviews.title: please buy something else
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a waste of money. Idk if it's just mine because it seems to work for other buyers. First of all, the bluetooth function does not work. It does not even show up anywhere. However, I was able to use ir to scan and get my stuff printed with the hpeprint. It was the only reason why I didn't return it. Guess what, the hpeprint stopped working too. I spent so many hours trying to work it out but the thing won't print. Now I'm stuck with a bulky piece of plastic I can't use. Please do yourself a favor and do not buy this. There are wayyyy better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Excellent service. Unbeatable price! HP has this ink subscription service where they automatically mail you ink when levels are low. And have low cost payment plans based on the frequency of printing. I basically get free ink and can always upgrade during tax season, for example, when I use the printer frequently to prep my own taxes. The HP Print app is excellent! I wish I can print high quality photos. I still need to tweak it. It could be bc I'm printing from facebook low quality photo downloads. I miss the email to HP printer email printing option. I hope one day they upgrade app to provide efax service. Besides that I absolutely love my HP printer!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha B.

customer_reviews.title: constant cartridge error after 8 months of ownership, no repair possible
customer_reviews.text: Feel deeply ripped off by HP. Everytime I print, I have to reinstall the ink cartridge. I've followed all the troubleshooting I could find online, and I even called customer support. They told me, since my 1 year warranty had expired (4 days prior), I would have to pay $20 for customer service over-the-phone, and even then there is no guarantee of a repair - and then he recommended the best action I could take to be buy a new HP printer. I was so angry. I still am, that's why I'm screaming into the void of an Amazon product review. DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. PRINTER. OR. ANY. OTHER. HP. PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: renaldo megna

customer_reviews.title: Compact, feature rich, and a good deal!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely satisfied with this printer. It is a relatively compact size. Bluetooth setup was a breeze. It is very quiet when printing. AND, of course, the print quality is very good! Automatic Double sided printing is great. All in all I really could not be more satisfied. For everyday use and space-saving this is a terrific choice for your home office. Also the price is excellent for the features and if you can pick one up through the Amazon Warehouse you will get an even better bargain.
customer_reviews.author: RiverdaleRob

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a year
customer_reviews.text: This piece of crap had connection issues from the start. It would intermittently lose connection to the wifi and I would have to reconnect/setup the connection again. Eventually (almost a year to the date I bought it) it came up with an error message and now is not sending out a signal to connect. It says it is connected to the wireless network, but anytime I go to print anything, it never prints. I now have to connect via USB to the printer to have it print. I didn't even get through the ink I bought for it! This printer sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, if you're not in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: My HP Envy has developed a VERY annoying habit of pausing for approximately 30 seconds in the middle of EVERY page. On the up-side it makes surprisingly good-quality copies, with good color. It's admittedly a little slow, a little noisy, and the paper tray only holds between 3/8" and 1/2" of paper. So I wouldn't think a person would want to use this for frequent, large-volume jobs. Set-up was surprisingly easy (I have a talent for messing up even the simplest of instructions, but this installation went very smoothly.)
customer_reviews.author: Waltzing Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Not excited about this product.
customer_reviews.text: After using Canon products for many years, I decided to make a change, and based on reading reviews--some negative, but mostly positive, I purchased this printer. After finally getting it to recognize my WiFi and connecting two PCs, it finally works, MOST of the time. I am pretty savvy about tech stuff and figured I should be able to figure it out, but it took a lot of time and patience. The print quality is good and I haven't tried pictures yet. The scanner program is easy to use. But, if I ever need another printer I think I will go back with a Canon.
customer_reviews.author: RV_there?

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong 4 years later
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer right here on Amazon in 2016 for $54.99, enrolled in HP instant ink, and haven't had any printer problems whatsoever. This printer went through my masters degree and my wife's bachelors without a single hiccup, and it is still going strong showing no sign of issues, printing about 50-200 pages per month for the past 4 years. Highly recommended, but try to find it cheaper. Technology that was 55 bucks 4 years ago shouldn't be almost 200 today.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: this is a joy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this printer! It is a replacement for a Consumer Reports Epson printer that was an absolute nightmare. Unlike the miserably complicated Epson, this is a joy to use. I plugged it in, followed the prompts, and it works perfectly. It does everything with one touch of a button. No complicated steps. Prints beautiful pictures, and does everything effortlessly. I signed up for the automatic ink deliveries, and that make the HP's performance flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Kind Soul

customer_reviews.title: So unhappy!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this printer despite the bad reviews and hoped for the best. I guess I lucked out because it has worked perfectly. However, I ordered one for my parents, and it's almost worthless. It won't stay connected, and the only way to reconnect it is to disconnect and reconnect the printer and router. Every. Single. Time. Not sure if I should return or exchange. Grrrrrrr
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started Great - Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It started out great then went down the tubes. It was so good, in fact, that I bought the same printer for my parents. Theirs started having problems for which I spent 3 hours with them trying to fix. Online help showed that the "Contacting Printer" issue they continued to have is all over the internet but with no good solution. Online HP help suggested we load an HP Smart iPhone app to resolve the issue. Did that and it worked for a day. I'm not wasting anymore time. Off to get another printer. Too bad but it was great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill for an inexpensive home printer
customer_reviews.text: I should preface this by saying that I really dislike the notion of these disposable printers, where it's more cost effective to replace them instead of fixing them or even buying new ink cartridges. I cringe to think of these in the landfills. Having said that, this seems to be a reasonable option as a home printer. I wanted something with a small footprint. There might have been a sturdier product out there, but not in the size I needed. The print quality is good enough for our needs (nothing professional). I don't understand all the negative reviews about the installation process. I literally took it out of the box, plugged it in & followed the on-screen instructions. Easy peasey.
customer_reviews.author: Dumb Luck

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, okay at first
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this printer I LOVED it. However, now every time I print, i get an "offline" error, which means I have to re-sync the printer to my wifi (which is a pain in the butt for every time I want to print something.) I googled the problem and it seems like a lot of people have the same problem and cannot figure out how to fix it. They have spent hours on the phone with HP to no avail. I myself have not called HP and keep trying to fix it on my own
customer_reviews.author: Kim Straub

customer_reviews.title: Endless Frustration
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been a nightmare. It constantly disconnects from my network and will not print more than a few pages without losing connection. I'm constantly power cycling. My network is strong & I even moved the printer to be right next to my wireless router in case there was a signal issue since it was previously in another room. Nope. HP tutorials, surveys, and support has been useless. I was hoping to connect the printer via Ethernet but there are no ports. Incredibly frustrating, and an absolute waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Haley S

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: The print quality on this machine means that it's almost useless for anything you wish to share with people. If you let it sit for more than a month unused, no amount of cleaning will help you, it will only work again with new cartridges. I needed something that could I used every month or so to print random things. Most of the time this thing fails or requires a new cartridge. Given the price of cartridges it's also cheaper to actually buy the printer again, which is weird and ridiculous. This machine is disposable and the quality is terrible. I deeply regret this purchase and the people who engineered this machine deserve to feel bad.
customer_reviews.author: J. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Machine, but Watch Out For Instant Ink Gimmick
customer_reviews.text: This printer surprised me with how versatile it is, but there is one massive drawback. It won't let you set it up without creating a payment plan for ink which is extremely limiting. Why is Hewlett-Packard making me pay extra just to use a device I already own? I will be removing those Instant Ink cartridges and using my regular ones I bought with it. If I print too often, it will only cost more. If I don't print often enough, the ink might dry out and ruin the printer. That said, at least you can cancel the Instant Ink subscription and use regular cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred D. Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! This is the second one that I have bought! I love that they are able to be connected to the HP instant ink program, which has come in big handy in my classroom. It's a great printer and copier for both home and work. At school I am able to quickly copy worksheets that I need for class if the copier for faculty is taken up. I also love that I can copy color pages for my kiddos. The color pages come out with great quality and the printer allows me to use different types of paper without jamming up! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Suess

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: HP Envy 4520 Wireless All-in-One Photo Printer...This is the worst printer I've ever encountered in my 50+ years in the computer business. It omits printing things like dates, check info, leaves blank pages. this is the worst printer I've ever encountered
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Low price = Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned other more expensive HP printers that were workhorses but this one was very disappointing. Quality decent on print but very poor pictures from the start, but wasn’t expecting much for this price. Signed up for their online ink replacement program but then cancelled as I wasn’t using this printer enough to warrant the monthly fee. Shortly after I did that, the ink needed to be replaced which I did with authentic HP cartridges. Ran the test sheet, wouldn’t calibrate correctly and hasn’t printed right ever since. The cost of two more ink cartridges is the same as purchasing another cheap printer so making a change!
customer_reviews.author: M. Borg

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews prior to buying and there was a mix of good and bad. What attracted me to it was the size and of course the price. I worry about getting the ink for the product but it seems available. I couldn't wait to set it up and use it. I tested it on most of the projects and it has not failed to produce a great product. I just tried printing a photo on plain paper which seemed pretty good. The real test will be on photo paper I may adjust my review but its not an issue at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easiest set-up and good value price
customer_reviews.text: Super easy set-up, did not need to download any software, I just added my wifi information to the device and was able to immediately print and scan. I was worried ordering an HP with all the instant ink warnings from other users, but I'm planning to buy ink the "old fashioned" way so hopefully it won't be an issue with the pop-ups that others have mentioned. I am using this to replace a 15 year old HP, so high hopes this will live a long life as well!
customer_reviews.author: lisek16

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, research the HP ink program before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice printer. I mainly use it for my home computer. I really like that I can instantly print things from my phone too. The one thing I don’t care for is the HP ink program. We usually print out a small amount monthly which doesn’t come close to the lowest package HP charges for. We’ve had this printer for over a year and only needed the ink replaced once. You may want to look into the program before you buy to see if it fits what you need. Overall I am happy with the way the printer has preformed and would buy it again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome easy to use printer....until it wasn't. Worked well every time and then one day it just stopped printing altogether. Lots of research to fix the problem has led me to the conclusion that one these printers act up they're done for. Seems to be no fix for the issue of printing blank pages. Too bad because up until now I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Smith

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to my computer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked for about 4 months. I don't print very often. One day the printer stopped printing. The printer connects to my WiFi but I can not get the computer to see the printer. I went through all of the steps for troubleshooting. I did the setup again. The Wireless Network Test results says the Configuration Source should show "DHCP". The configuration page shows "Manual". I went in further and it says DHCP is Enabled. There is no option of a USB port to connect the printer. And now it is too late to get my money back. I spent $68 for it working just 4 months. I'll never buy a wireless printer again.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stopped printing
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great for the first couple of months I owned it. When I replaced one of the ink cartridges, it stopped printing entirely, unless I uninstalled the printer, reinstalled it and then I was able to make one (count 'em, one) print before it stopped again. Sometimes it'll print one pdf, sometimes one recipe from a web page. Never more than one of anything. I spend way more time troubleshooting than I do using the printer, even just for one form or document.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great printer & Awesome Instant Ink program
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and I bought this printer to be able to participate in the instant ink program. The printer and the iip are great!! The best part of the printer is that it auto prints on both sides! The pics are samples of a projects I printed with this printer. Great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Adams

customer_reviews.title: What an incredible piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to buy this machine, make sure you buy a baseball bat to go with it so that you can take it outside and beat the crap out of it Office Space style shortly after you get it. It was easy enough to set up, but in the 4 weeks I have owned it, it has printed easily ONCE. All other attempts to print have been thwarted by the printer just not responding for no apparent reason, paper jam (which the machine still complained about even after resolved), cartridge jam (which didn’t exist but the machine still complained about). I literally want to rip it out of the wall and throw it through the window.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS FOR PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this printer! I’m glad I waited the 2 days for Amazon Prime shipping and ordered from Amazon as opposed to getting it at Walmart like I almost messed up and did...prior to whipping out my iPhone and checking Amazon for comparison and benefits of reviews! This printer is fast and efficient and is easy breezy to set up! Such a great price too for a wireless printer. Cannot best HP products.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Performance may vary
customer_reviews.text: With my last wireless router, it would constantly disconnect from my computer, forcing me to restart and reboot almost every time I wanted to print or scan something. I've moved and it's working great. I've had some issues with photo printing alignment and non-HP registered ink cartridges dying way faster than they should but sucking it up and paying the extra for them has made this a very consistent printer/scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Joe E

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! I decided to replace my photosmart 5520 and I'm glad I did! The best part is the free ink for 3 months and then only 4.95 month. No more refilling ink and spilling it.ending up with ink everywhere. Their thing monitors your ink levels for you and sends you new ones when you're low. Now to see if it gets to Alaska in good timing. You will love this printer. Only thing I wish it had was a scan auto feed on top but mobile scanners on your phone are working better nowadays so if I can't get to my printer I use that.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: HP printers do not work with HP products: Do not buy HP products
customer_reviews.text: I bought the printer in 2017 for printing needs at school. I have only used HP cartridges and have ordered them through Amazon. The printer will not print. It keeps saying I have the wrong cartridges. There is no help or support from HP. It is a waste of time to contact the tech department. Keep sending you to a virtual help center. Nothing works. I have two new cartridges from Amazon, and I can't use them. I will need to replace the printer, and will not by another HP product.
customer_reviews.author: baseball9585

customer_reviews.title: Never connects to devices
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s a decent printer. The trouble is getting it to connect with any device we have. We’ve had this printer for three years now and I dread printing from it. It’s a circus act trying to get it to work, it’s always sleeping and simply touching it’s screen while on and idle does nothing when you need it to print. I have to screw around with everything unplugging, restarting, checking connections. Most the time it still won’t connect, 90% of the time I have to email my documents and photos to get it to work. It’s on and connected to the internet however my iPhone and laptop can never connect.
customer_reviews.author: Beblavy

customer_reviews.title: No. Just no.
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer I have ever had. The first one worked for a few weeks. Then it wouldn’t connect wirelessly. So amazon replaced it. The new one worked ok for a while but then started leaving nonprinted areas on my pages. So I contacted customer support and they sent me a new cartridge. It worked for a while. But now it says the color cartridge isn’t compatible and no matter what I do it won’t use it. And the black cartridge doesn’t work either. It prints a tiny part of each line. Sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Page

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!! *UPDATE BELOW!!*
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in December and I now can NOT PRINT a single page without it jamming!! It's beyond irritating! It's always jammed here and there but now it does it every SINGLE time!! **Update!! I returned this printer without difficulty. The replacement printer has been working great!! Updated to 4 stars!
customer_reviews.author: NurseWendy515

customer_reviews.title: Can't use it because I can't get it back online.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this printer 1 time and the next time I tried to use it, it says it is offline. There is no way to turn the printer back online with the app or the physical printer. Tried turning it off, unplugging it and restarting it but it is still offline.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2018 and now it will not accept any new ink cartridges. It repeatedly tells me that the ones I have in there are not installed properly. I am in nursing school and we have to print a butt load of paper all semester for clinical prep forms, papers to sign, assignments, papers, rubrics... you name it we print it. I have multiple projects due right now and my printer decided to malfunction at the worst possible time. I am thoroughly disappointed in a pretty reputable brand. Buyer bewar.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Parks

customer_reviews.title: No Technical Support
customer_reviews.text: I spent the last (3) days trying to figure out why the scanner does not connect to my note book. The scanner was working fine and then I lost internet connection for a day and I am no longer able to scan from my note book. I uninstalled and reinstalled the drivers. I used scan doctor and virtual assistant to trouble shoot the issue and NOTHING works. HP provides no technical support. HP printers are horribly unreliable. I called HP and I was directed back to the virtual assistant. By the time you understand how to use the machine it is obsolete. HP machines are a waste of time, money, and a detriment to the environment.
customer_reviews.author: CATHY

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: If you can get the printer to work, it's fine. Each time I use the printer I have to reset everything and consult help articles (because there's a different reason it disconnects every time). Support articles are helpful for Windows users, but do not cover Mac help whatsoever. This printer is virtually useless in 9/10 cases. In the support articles it states that you have to have it plugged in directly into a wall outlet or it will disconnect from wireless. Nonsense. Not a fan, didn't expect it to be this disastrous for so long or I'd have returned it. Consider a different printer for reliability's sake.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Help.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have ever owned. I cannot print draft or fast economical printing. Whenever I adjust to those settings when I print it automatically changes to best print and both side printing. I am therefore using plenty ink for draft documents. I have to use another printer for most of my work. HP help is also very unhelpful. The only positive is the wireless nature. I have just thrown it out the window. I hope I do not get sued if it falls on someone's head.
customer_reviews.author: BingD

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer known to man
customer_reviews.text: If you spent 100 years trying to make a more frustrating printer, you couldn't do it. 1. Constantly loses network connection and the way they have you re-enter the password is so frustrating 2. Very flimsy - pieces fall off of this thing all the time 3. It locks up constantly and then I have to unplug it and plug it back in to reset it 4. The initial setup was horrible I wish Amazon had negative stars as that's the only way to really rate this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer based on several rave reviews from my coworkers. My first issue is that after printing 3 color pages, the blue is empty. Now, I signed up for insta-ink, but give me a break! They didnt even give me enough ink to get me through until my new cartridges arrived (which were shipped the day I received the printer). And let me say, that for $70, I did not expect a lightning fast printer. But I did expect it to print as fast as the one I just tossed out from 1998. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Beal

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and I was a bit leery about the purchase. I did have an issue of installing it online, so I used the CD that came with it, not a problem. I don't know about all the emails or notifications about ink, I haven't seen any. It does what I need it to do, faster and two sided without me having to manually flipping the pages. The quality is what I expected. If you have an older computer just be aware that you need to check that you have the correct version of windows before you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the instant ink program
customer_reviews.text: Fine little printer, works well. I signed up for the ink replenishment program for $3 a month. A few months later I ran over a bit and was hit with a $15 bill yet they haven't sent any ink in the last six months.When I tried to cancel they threw up every roadblock they could come up with and it took some heated demanding to get it cancelled. Buyer beware! Update: They tried to charge me for another month even though I had cancelled membership over a month earlier. After an unpleasant interaction they gave in reluctantly and credited back the charge. Beware, this is a scam.
customer_reviews.author: Thib

customer_reviews.title: Not Connected.....Cable Connected
customer_reviews.text: The initial set up seemed simple and easy. Now after only a few print jobs the printer is off line. Here I go spending countless hours trying to do another set up and the thought of HP customer support makes me ill. Why can't the printer just work. It will not even communicate with a printer cable. I am very disappointed. I will update. I spoke with HP support. They were quick and helpful. Bottom line.....with my wireless router, the IP address gets dropped, so I must use a hard connection. Not really a big deal. I like the printer, copy, and scan, so I have upped my stars. A good printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia J.

customer_reviews.title: Best printer
customer_reviews.text: For the price I am in love with this printer. Replaced an epson I just bought 6 months ago that stopped working :(. Should have bought HP to start! HP never fails me. Good print quality, wireless printing, easy scanning, prints double sided. Hp ink is available everywhere - that's a plus too. Even the local rite aid sells it if in a pinch for ink. Prints a little slow but I don't print large amounts at once - it isn't a problem. I Definitely recommend this printer - you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer until you need ink
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. Very happy until placing high quality recycled cartridges in the printer to print - then it shuts down. It DEMANDS that you purchase only HP cartridges from the HP site. What a scam! This was not stated in the product description and I will be contacting Amazon as it ought to be required to share with customers that you will be beholden to the HP company for any and all ink forever. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Merri Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever
customer_reviews.text: We have a Mac computer. This printer sucks is about every way imaginable. Needs to be restarted for EVERY print job. When you replace the cartridges (with the CORRECT one), you continually get an "incompatible cartridge" error message. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: A nice-looking and expensive brick.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 4520 and received the 4511. I should have sent it back, but I kept it for what's been three years now, and I have never NEVER gotten this thing to actually print. I've tried all manner of ink cartridge replacements, troubleshooting, contacting their tech support and getting nowhere. The touch screen is fabulous. The wireless connection is great. The set-up process was super easy. It would be a very nifty machine if it ever worked.
customer_reviews.author: Shellzilla

customer_reviews.title: Less than crisp printing
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a similar HP printer with this budget model. It works well, is pretty quiet, is handsome and unobtrusive. However, the print is noticeably darker, broader, and less crisp than our old printer. The paper tray holder fewer sheets. It looks much less laser-like and, obviously, will use more ink. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GPsy

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap printer
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap printer does what I want it to do. I don't print pictures it's a waste of money when Walgreens or whomever does it so cheap. Used to have a great picture printer I purchase 5-6 years ago printed great but always had issues with it telling me cartridge was damaged or missing ever time I replaced them and they weren't even after I'd clean the head off. And cartridges were $100 for all now they are $30 for both and printer cost me $45 so if it goes down I'll just launch it out the window and grab a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Z. Porter

product_meta.title: HP Envy 4520 Wireless All-in-One Photo Printer with Mobile Printing,HP Instant Ink or Amazon Dash replenishment ready (F0V69A)
product_meta.description:
Style:PrinterYou can afford to be creative with HP Instant Ink: Save up to 50% on ink and never run out. Print lab-quality photos at home for pennies. Full of value. Print up to twice as many pages or photos with Original HP high-yield ink cartridges. Get high-quality prints—time after time—with an all-in-one designed and built to be reliable. 

Easy photo printing from your mobile device: Your device, your choice. Easily print documents and photos from a variety of smartphones and tablets. Start printing and get connected quickly with easy setup from your smartphone, tablet, or PC. Connect your smartphone or tablet directly to your printer—and easily print without accessing a network. 

Everything you need to create: Print, scan, or copy quickly and easily with the 2.2-inch (5.5 cm) display—simply touch and go. Save paper and conserve resources—use up to 50% less paper with easy, automatic two-sided printing. Print borderless, lab-quality photos, laser-quality documents, scrapbook pages, and more—right in your home. 

Do more in less space: Save your space with a sleek, compact all-in-one designed to fit where you need it. Print in any room you choose—without causing disruptions—using the optional quiet mode. Access menu planners, news reports, recipes, and more with free HP Printables—delivered on your schedule.
feature_bullets: Main functions of this HP color inkjet photo printer: copy, scan, wireless printing, AirPrint, two-sided duplex printing, touchscreen, Instant Ink ready so you'll never run out of ink, and more

Mobile printing: print from anywhere using your smartphone or tablet with the free HP ePrint app, easily print from your iPhone with AirPrint, print even without a network using Wireless Direct printing
Borderless photos are printed right to the edge of the paper. You get beautiful photo prints with no trimming!
2-sided printing: Allows you to print on both sides of the page, cutting your paper use by up to 50%

Save up to 50% on ink with HP Instant Ink: ordered by your printer and delivered to your door before you run out (optional subscription required). Use Original HP 63 ink cartridges to print up to 2x the pages as refilled cartridges
Print, scan, or copy quickly and easily with the 2.2-inch (5.5 cm) display—simply touch and go
Paper sizes supported: Letter, legal, 4 x 6 in, 5 x 7 in, 8 x 10 in, No. 10 envelopes
One-year limited hardware warranty; 24-hour, 7 days a week Web support
